Nicaraguan President Supports Fighting Cause of Korean People
articles.content:
Nicaraguan President Supports Fighting Cause of Korean People 
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Nicaraguan President Enrique Bolanos Geyer, when receiving credentials from Ri Kang Se, new DPRK ambassador e. p. to the Republic of Nicaragua, expressed the belief that the efforts of the Korean people for the building of a prosperous society and national reunification would certainly bear fruits.
 Hoping for the peace and stability of the Korean peninsula, the president stressed that the peace of the peninsula was maintained these days by the efforts of the DPRK.    
 He expressed the hope that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop to a higher level.

articles.title: "Ulji Focus Lens 04" Joint Maneuver Announced
articles.content:
"Ulji Focus Lens 04" Joint Maneuver Announced 
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korea-U.S. "Combined Forces Command" on August 4 announced that the "Ulji Focus Lens 04" joint military drill would be staged, according to foreign press reports.
 Units of the U.S. forces present in south Korea, south Korean army and some units of the U.S. forces overseas will take part in the war game covering the period from August 23 to September 3, which is aimed at "assessing and improving the performance of the joint action."    
 The U.S. is bent on extremely reckless and dangerous military exercises to plunge the Korean peninsula into a nuclear holocaust, while maliciously pursuing a hostile policy towards the DPRK.

Palestinian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Palestinian Ambassador Hosts Reception 
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Shaher Mohammed Abdlah, Palestinian ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps Thursday evening to mark the 51st anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the great Fatherland Liberation War and the 59th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
 Present on invitation were Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, and officials concerned.    
 Speeches were made there.

Kim Yong Nam Meets Director-General of FAO
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Director-General of FAO
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with Jaques Diouf, director-general of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO), at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand was Choe Su Hon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs who is chairman of the Korean National Committee of the FAO.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Laurent Gbagbo, president of Cote d'Ivoire, on August 6 on the occasion of the 44th anniversary of the independence of the country.
 Hoping that the efforts of the president and the people of Cote d'Ivoire for the peace and stability of the country and national unity would be crowned with success, the message expressed the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets U.S. Figure
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets U.S. Figure
    Pyongyang, August 6 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and conversed with Donald Greg, president of the Korea Associated of the United States who is former U.S. ambassador to south Korea, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Friday.
